included in the computation of display surface area.
SIGN, ILLUMINATED: A sign designed to give forth any artificial light, or
designed to reflect light from one or more sources, natural or artificial.
SIGN, PROJECTING: A sign erected on the face or outside wall of a building
which projects out at any angle therefrom.
SIGN, TEMPORARY: Signs of a temporary nature used to advertise the premises for
sale, rent, or lease.
STORY: That portion of a building included between the surface of any floor and
the surface of the floor next above it; or, if there be no floor above it, then
the space between the floor and the ceiling next above it.
STREET: A public right of way more than thirty feet (30') in width which
provides the primary public means of access to abutting property and used
primarily for vehicular circulation.
STREET, ARTERIAL: Any street designated on the comprehensive plan as an
arterial, primary arterial, secondary arterial, major street, etc.
STREET, MINOR: Any street not designated on the comprehensive plan as an
arterial.
STRUCTURAL ALTERATION: Any change in the structural members of a building, such
as walls, columns, beams or girders.
STRUCTURE: Anything constructed, the use of which requires permanent location
on the ground or attachment to something having a permanent location on the
ground (not including sidewalks, driveways and similar improvement areas).
THOROUGHFARE PLAN: The part of the comprehensive plan referring to
transportation development goals, principles, and standards; also includes use
of the words "major street plan" and "trafficways plan".
TRAILER: A portable or mobile unit, other than a mobile home, used or designed
to carry or transport material or animals.
YARD: A required space on a lot unobstructed, except as expressly permitted.
YARD, FRONT: A yard extending across the full width of a lot from side lot line
to side lot line, abutting on a street, into which a building may not protrude.
YARD, REAR: A yard extending across the rear of a lot measured from side lot
line to side lot line.
YARD, SIDE: A yard extending from front yard to the rear yard abutting the side
lot line, into which no building may protrude. (1987 Code § 12-215; amd. Ord.
1997-05, 5-1-1997; Ord. 2000-02, 3-10-2000; 2004 Code; Ord. 2008-02, 3-27-2008)

1 1. See also section
  10-2A-2 of this code.
2 2. See also section
  10-2B-1 of this code.
CHAPTER 2
ENFORCEMENT; GENERAL ZONING REGULATIONS
SECTION:
11-2-1: Zoning Administrator
11-2-2: Zoning Clearance Permit Requirements
11-2-3: Platting Requirements On Rezoning Applications
11-2-4: Penalty
11-2-1: ZONING ADMINISTRATOR:
   A.   Office Created: There is hereby created the office of zoning
administrator to enforce this title.
   B.   Duties: If the zoning administrator shall find that any of the
provisions of this title are being violated, he shall notify in writing the
persons responsible for such violations, indicating the nature of the violation
and ordering the action necessary to correct it, and shall take such other
action as is authorized by law to ensure compliance with, or to prevent
violation of, its provisions. (1987 Code § 12-310)
   C.   City Clerk Authority: The duties of zoning administrator are delegated
to the city clerk. (1987 Code § 12-310; amd. 2004 Code)
11-2-2: ZONING CLEARANCE PERMIT REQUIREMENTS:
   A.   Permit Described: The zoning clearance permit is a permit issued by the
zoning administrator which states that a particular development meets all of
the requirements of the zoning regulations. It is not a building permit and
does not authorize construction; it certifies that the land or structure is in
conformance with the terms of this title. (1987 Code § 12-311)
   B.   Permit Required:
      1.   New Construction: No building or other structure shall be erected,
constructed, enlarged, altered or repaired in such a manner as to prolong the
life of the building, nor shall the use of any land or building or other
structure be changed without a zoning clearance permit being issued authorizing
such construction, alteration, repair, or use changes as being in compliance
with the provisions of this title. No building permit shall be issued for any
construction not conforming to a valid zoning clearance permit. (1987 Code §
12-312)
      2.   Change In Use Of Land Or Building: No change shall be made in the
use of any land or building or structure after the adoption of this title until
a zoning clearance permit has been obtained, certifying that all the provisions
of this title have been complied with. (1987 Code § 12-313)
   C.   Application For Permit: An application for a zoning clearance permit
shall be made to the zoning administrator by the owner or proposed occupant of
the building or land to be occupied or used, and the application shall state
the location and legal description of the property and set out in detail the
character and nature of the use to be conducted thereon. Within three (3) days,
the zoning administrator shall grant or deny the zoning clearance permit in
accordance with the terms of this title. (1987 Code § 12-314)
   D.   Accompanying Material: All applications for zoning clearance permits
shall be accompanied by a plat plan, drawn to scale on suitable paper, showing
the actual dimensions of the lot to be built upon, the size and location of the
building to be erected, and such other information as may be necessary to
satisfy the requirements of this title. (1987 Code § 12-315)
   E.   Permit Fee: Zoning clearance permits shall not be issued until a fee as
set by motion or resolution of the city council shall have been paid. (1987
Code § 12-316; amd. 2004 Code)
11-2-3: PLATTING REQUIREMENTS ON REZONING APPLICATIONS:
For the purpose of providing a proper arrangement of streets and assuring the
adequacy of open spaces for traffic, utilities, and access of emergency
vehicles, commensurate with the intensification of land use customarily
incident to a change of zoning, a platting requirement is established as
follows:
For any land which has been rezoned upon application of a private party, no
building permit or zoning clearance permit shall be issued until that portion
of the tract on which the permit is sought has been included within a
subdivision plat or replat, as the case may be, submitted to, and approved by,
the city council upon the recommendation of the planning commission, and filed
of record in the office of the county clerk where the property is situated.
Provided that the city council, upon the recommendation of the planning
commission, may remove the platting requirement upon a determination that the
above stated purposes have been achieved by previous platting or could not be
achieved by a plat or replat. (1987 Code § 12-317)
11-2-4: PENALTY:
A violation of this title shall be deemed a misdemeanor and shall be punishable
by fine. Any person, firm or corporation who violates or refuses to comply with
any of the provisions of this title shall be subject to penalty as provided in
section
1-4-1 of this code for each offense. Each day that a violation is permitted to
exist shall constitute a separate offense. (1987 Code § 12-318; amd. 2004 Code)
CHAPTER 3
ZONING DISTRICTS; MAP
SECTION:
11-3-1: Zoning Districts Established
11-3-2: Official Zoning Map
11-3-3: District Boundaries
11-3-1: ZONING DISTRICTS ESTABLISHED:
For the purpose of this title and the promotion of public health, safety and
general welfare of the community, the following districts are hereby
established for the city:
 
A-1 General agricultural district
A-2 Suburban agricultural district
R   General residential district
C-1 Neighborhood shopping district
C-2 General commercial district
C-3 Intensive commercial district
I   General industrial district
 
(1987 Code § 12-210)
11-3-2: OFFICIAL ZONING MAP:
   A.   Zoning Map Established: The locations and boundaries of the zoning
districts shall be established by ordinance and shall be delineated and shown
on a map entitled "zoning map of the city of McLoud, Oklahoma", and the zoning
map is hereby incorporated as a part of this title. (1987 Code § 12-211)
   B.   Maintenance Of Current Map: It is the duty of the zoning administrator
to maintain an up to date official zoning map of the city, including all
amendments directly adopted by the city council. (1987 Code § 12-213)
11-3-3: DISTRICT BOUNDARIES:
The boundaries of a zoning district shall extend to a centerline of abutting
streets, regardless of the legal description used in establishing such
districts. In the event of uncertainty in the exact boundaries of any of the
districts as shown on the zoning map of the city, the planning commission, upon
written application or upon its own motion, shall recommend the location of
such boundaries to the board of adjustment and the board of adjustment shall
make the final determination. (1987 Code § 12-212)
CHAPTER 4
AGRICULTURAL DISTRICTS
ARTICLE A. A-1 GENERAL AGRICULTURAL DISTRICT
SECTION:
11-4A-1: General Description
11-4A-2: Uses Permitted
11-4A-3: Area And Height Regulations
11-4A-4: Signs And Billboards
11-4A-1: GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
The A-1 general agricultural district is established for several purposes:
   A.   To provide for the continued use of land for predominantly agricultural
purposes;
   B.   To preserve undeveloped areas until they can feasibly be developed to
urban standards and with adequate public safeguards of health, safety, etc.;
and
   C.   To restrict development in areas subject to severe inundation until
such time as it can be shown that these areas are no longer subject to
flooding. (1987 Code § 12-250)
11-4A-2: USES PERMITTED:
Within the A-1 general agricultural district, the following uses are permitted:
Accessory buildings or uses incidental to the following listed principal uses.
"Agriculture", as defined in section
11-1-6 of this title.
Churches and temples.
Elementary schools and high schools.
Extraction of sand, gravel and other minerals not involving any operation
requiring the use of explosives.
Farmers' markets as provided in title 3, chapter 7 of this code.
Golf courses, but not including golf driving ranges, pitch and putt courses, or
miniature golf courses.
Mobile homes.
Municipal or community recreation centers.
Parks and forest preserves not operated for profit.
Police or fire stations.
Public buildings or buildings operated in the public interest by a not for
profit corporation, including art galleries, post offices, libraries, or
museums.
Public or not for profit auditoriums, stadiums, arenas, armories, or
sanatoriums.
Public or private hospitals or sanatoriums.
Public or private schools or colleges.
Public utility and service uses including electric substations, gas regulator
stations, electric, gas, telegraph, telephone and water transmission metering
and distribution equipment and structures, microwave relay towers, water
reservoirs or pumping stations and other similar facilities.
Single-family dwellings.
Temporary buildings and uses for construction purposes only and not for
dwelling purposes, nor for a period that exceeds the completion of
construction. (1987 Code § 12-251; amd. Ord. 2014-13, 10-23-2014)
11-4A-3: AREA AND HEIGHT REGULATIONS:
   A.   Lot Area: All lots shall have not less than five (5) acres of land, and
not more than one principal building shall be placed on any one lot.
   B.   Frontage: Each lot shall have a frontage of not less than three hundred
thirty feet (330'), and the depth shall not exceed two and one-half (21/2)
times the frontage of the lot.
   C.   Coverage: Not more than ten percent (10%) of the lot area shall be
covered with improvements. Paved areas are not considered improvements within
the meaning of this provision.
   D.   Yards:
      1.   Front: All structures shall have not less than a fifty foot (50')
front yard setback.
      2.   Side: All principal structures shall have not less than a thirty
foot (30') side yard setback. Accessory buildings may have side yards of not
less than ten feet (10').
      3.   Rear: All principal structures shall have not less than a fifty foot
(50') rear yard setback. Accessory buildings may have a rear yard of not less
than ten feet (10'). (1987 Code § 12-252; amd. 2004 Code)
11-4A-4: SIGNS AND BILLBOARDS 1 :
No signs, posters, bulletin boards, or other similar displays shall be
permitted in the A-1 district, except as follows:
   A.   Bulletin Board: One bulletin board may be erected on each street
frontage of an educational, religious, institutional, or similar use requiring
an announcement of its activities. The bulletin board shall not exceed twelve
(12) square feet in surface area nor fifteen feet (15') in height, and
illumination, if any, shall be by constant light.
   B.   Identification Sign: One identification sign may be erected on each
street frontage of a single-family subdivision or permitted nonresidential use.
The sign shall not exceed twelve (12) square feet in surface area nor fifteen
feet (15') in height, and illumination, if any, shall be by constant light.
   C.   Real Estate Sign: A real estate sign advertising the sale, rental or
lease of the premises or an approved development area may be erected on each
street frontage of the parcel, development, or other agricultural, commercial
or industrial zoned tract having the same ownership as that of the property,
premises or tract being advertised. The sign shall not exceed one hundred fifty
(150) square feet in individual surface area nor fifteen feet (15') in height;
and illumination, if any, shall be by constant light. (1987 Code § 12-253)
 
Notes
1 1. See also title 9, chapter 9 of this code.
ARTICLE B. A-2 SUBURBAN AGRICULTURAL DISTRICT
SECTION:
11-4B-1: General Description
11-4B-2: Uses Permitted
11-4B-3: Area And Height Regulations
11-4B-4: Aerobic Sewer System
11-4B-5: Signs And Billboards
11-4B-1: GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
This district is intended to provide for the land situated in the urbanizing
areas of the community where either public water or public sewer is not
available and is used for residential and agricultural purposes or which is
being platted into rural estate type development. Since tracts in this district
will contain residences in close proximity to agricultural activities, such
agricultural activities conducted in this district should not be detrimental to
urban land uses. (Ord. 2006-08, 7-27-2006)
11-4B-2: USES PERMITTED:
Within the A-2 suburban agricultural district, the following uses are
permitted:
Accessory buildings or uses incidental to the following listed principal uses.
"Agriculture", as defined in section
11-1-6 of this title.
Churches and temples.
Elementary schools and high schools.
Farmers' markets as provided in title 3, chapter 7 of this code.
Golf courses, but not including golf driving ranges, pitch and putt courses, or
miniature golf courses.
Municipal or community recreation centers.
Parks not operated for profit.
Police or fire station.
Public buildings or buildings operated in the public interest by a not for
profit corporation, including art galleries, post offices, libraries, or
museums.
Public or not for profit auditoriums, stadiums, arenas, armories, or
sanatoriums.
Public or private hospitals or sanatoriums.
Public or private schools or colleges.
Public utility and service uses including electric substations, gas regulator
stations, electric, gas, telegraph, telephone and water transmission metering
and distribution equipment and structures, microwave relay towers, water
reservoirs or pumping stations and other similar facilities.
Single-family dwellings.
Temporary buildings and uses for construction purposes only and not for
dwelling purposes, nor for a period that exceeds the completion of
construction. (Ord. 2006-08, 7-27-2006; amd. Ord. 2014-13, 10-23-2014)
11-4B-3: AREA AND HEIGHT REGULATIONS:
   A.   Requirements: All lots and improvements within the A-2 district shall
meet the following requirements:
      1.   Minimum lot area:
         a.   Two (2) acres where neither public water or public sewer systems
are available; or
         b.   One acre where either a public water system or a public sewer
system is available.
      2.   Minimum lot area for mobile homes: Five (5) acres.
   B.   Use Of Lot: No more than one principal building shall be placed on any
one lot.
   C.   Frontage: Each lot shall have a frontage of not less than one hundred
fifty feet (150').
   D.   Coverage: Not more than twenty percent (20%) of the lot area shall be
covered with improvements. Paved areas are not considered improvements within
the meaning of this provision.
   E.   Height: No improvement or structure shall exceed thirty five feet (35')
in height above the mean elevation of the lot.
   F.   Yards:
      1.   Front: All structures shall have not less than a thirty foot (30')
front yard setback.
      2.   Side: All principal structures shall have not less than a twenty
five foot (25') side yard setback. Accessory buildings may have side yards of
not less than ten feet (10').
      3.   Rear: All principal structures shall have not less than a fifty foot
(50') rear yard setback. Accessory buildings may have a rear yard of not less
than ten feet (10'). (Ord. 2006-08, 7-27-2006)
11-4B-4: AEROBIC SEWER SYSTEM:
Aerobic sewer systems may be installed on any lot within the A-2 district,
subject to the following conditions and restrictions:
   A.   Minimum Lot Area:
      1.   The minimum lot area shall be as established by applicable state
rules and/or regulations depending upon the type of system to be installed.
(Ord. 2014-07, 8-28-2014)
   B.   Frontage: Each lot shall have a frontage of not less than one hundred
feet (100').
      1.   If the parcel of land is a wedge shaped lot which meets the
requirements of minimum lot size, it may have less than the minimum requirement
for frontage as long as the front building line of the lot meets the
requirements hereinabove.
   C.   Maximum Coverage: The maximum coverage of any lot with an aerobic sewer
system shall not exceed sixty percent (60%) of the area for interior lots nor
seventy five percent (75%) of the lot area for corner lots.
   D.   Yard Requirements: The following minimum setback requirements for yards
shall apply to any use that is constructed or commenced on a parcel of land in
the A-2 district with an aerobic sewer system:
 
Permitted Use Front Yard Side Yard       Rear Yard
                         Both    One
Single-family 30 feet    15 feet 10 feet 20% lot depth
 
   E.   Use Of Lot: No more than one principal building shall be placed on any
one lot.
   F.   Restrictions: No farm livestock will be permitted on property that is
less than two (2) acres. This includes horses, cattle, swine, goats, chickens.
(Ord. 2006-08, 7-27-2006)
11-4B-5: SIGNS AND BILLBOARDS 1 :
No signs, posters, bulletin boards, or other similar displays shall be
permitted in the A-2 district, except as follows:
   A.   Bulletin Board: One bulletin board may be erected on each street
frontage of an educational, religious, institutional, or similar use requiring
an announcement of its activities. The bulletin board shall not exceed twelve
(12) square feet in surface area nor fifteen feet (15') in height, and
illumination, if any, shall be by constant light.
   B.   Identification Sign: One identification sign may be erected on each
street frontage of a single-family subdivision or permitted nonresidential use.
The sign shall not exceed twelve (12) square feet in surface area nor fifteen
feet (15') in height, and illumination, if any, shall be by constant light.
   C.   Real Estate Sign: A real estate sign advertising the sale, rental or
lease of the premises or an approved development area may be erected on each
street frontage of the parcel, development, or other agricultural, commercial
or industrial zoned tract having the same ownership as that of the property,
premises or tract being advertised. The sign shall not exceed one hundred fifty
(150) square feet in individual surface area nor fifteen feet (15') in height;
and illumination, if any, shall be by constant light. (Ord. 2006-08, 7-27-2006)

1 1. See also title 9, chapter 9 of this code.
CHAPTER 5
R GENERAL RESIDENTIAL DISTRICT
SECTION:
11-5-1: General Description
11-5-2: Uses Permitted
11-5-3: Minimum Lot Size
11-5-4: Maximum Coverage
11-5-5: Yard Requirements
11-5-6: Height Limit
11-5-7: Off Street Parking
11-5-8: Signs
11-5-9: Structure Size
11-5-1: GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
The R general residential district is established as a district in which the
use of land is for residential purposes and uses directly incidental thereto.
It is the purpose and intent of this district to promote the development and
the continued use of the land for family dwellings and to prohibit commercial
and industrial use or any other use which would substantially interfere with,
or adversely affect, the desirable quality of a residential environment. The
intent is to further discourage any use in this district which would generate
traffic or create congestion on neighborhood streets other than the normal
traffic which serves the residents in this area. (1987 Code § 12-260)
11-5-2: USES PERMITTED:
Property and buildings in the R general residential district may be used for
the following purposes:
Accessory buildings and uses customarily incidental to the following listed
uses when located on the same lot.
Agricultural uses of the garden type that are not intended for commercial
purposes.
Churches.
Duplex.
Mobile home trailer park 1 .
Modular homes.
Multi-family dwellings.
Public park, playground, fire station, community center, hospital, or other
similar public facility.
Public schools, and private schools where the curriculum is similar in nature
and preparation of course work to the public schools.
Rooming or boarding house.
Single-family detached dwellings. (1987 Code § 12-261; amd. 2004 Code; Ord.
2008-02, 3-27-2008)
 
Notes
1 1. See subsection 10-2B-4C of this code.
11-5-3: MINIMUM LOT SIZE:
   A.   Water And Sewer Available: Where both a public water supply system and
a public sewer system is available, no structure or use shall be constructed or
commenced in the R district which does not conform with the following minimum
requirements for lot size:
 
Permitted Use     Minimum Lot Area                    Minimum Frontage2
Single-family     9,000 square feet per dwelling unit 70 feet1
Two-family        5,000 square feet per dwelling unit 80 feet1
Multi-family      2,500 square feet per dwelling unit 100 feet1
Churches          1 acre                              100 feet
Mobile home parks 21/2 acres                          200 feet
All other uses    1 acre                              80 feet
 
   Notes:
      1.   If the lot is a wedge shaped lot which meets the requirements of
minimum lot size, it may have less than the minimum requirement for frontage as
long as the front building line of the lot meets the requirements hereinabove.
      2.   The depth of the lot shall not exceed 21/2 times the frontage of the
lot.
   (1987 Code § 12-262)
   B.   Water And Sewer Not Available Or One System Available: The minimum
required lot area for all uses permitted in the R district, except mobile home
parks, shall be the minimum required under applicable state law, rule or
regulation where there is neither a public water supply system nor a public
sewer system available, and the minimum required under applicable state law,
rule or regulation where either a public water supply system or a public sewer
system, one or the other, is available. In all instances, the minimum lot area
required for a mobile home park in an R district shall be two (2) acres if
neither city water nor sewer is available, and one acre where either service is
available. (Ord. 2014-08, 8-28-2014)
11-5-4: MAXIMUM COVERAGE:
The maximum coverage of any lot in the R district shall not exceed sixty
percent (60%) of the area for interior lots nor seventy five percent (75%) of
the lot area for corner lots. (1987 Code § 12-263)
11-5-5: YARD REQUIREMENTS:
The following minimum requirements for yards shall apply to any use that is
constructed or commenced on a parcel of land in the R district:
 
Permitted Use  Front Yard Side Yard       Rear Yard
                          Both    One
Single-family  25 feet    10 feet 5 feet  20% lot depth
Two-family     25 feet    10 feet 5 feet  20% lot depth
Multi-family   20 feet    15 feet 5 feet  20% lot depth
All other uses 20 feet    30 feet 15 feet 20% lot depth
 
(1987 Code § 12-264)
11-5-6: HEIGHT LIMIT:
No dwelling structure in the R district shall be constructed with a height in
excess of thirty five feet (35') from the mean lot elevation. (1987 Code § 12-
265)
11-5-7: OFF STREET PARKING:
Off street parking shall be provided as required in chapter 9 of this title.
(1987 Code § 12-266)
11-5-8: SIGNS 1 :
No signs, posters, bulletin boards, or other similar displays shall be
permitted in the R district, except as follows:
   A.   Temporary Bulletin Board; Lease Or Sale Of Building: A temporary
bulletin board or sign not exceeding twelve (12) square feet in area,
pertaining to the lease, hire or sale of a building or premises, which board or
sign shall be removed as soon as the premises are leased, hired or sold.
   B.   Bulletin Board; Announcement Of Activities: One bulletin board may be
erected on each street frontage of an educational, religious, institutional or
similar use requiring announcement of its activities. The bulletin board shall
not exceed twelve (12) square feet in surface area nor fifteen feet (15') in
height; and illumination, if any, shall be by constant light.
   C.   Public Notices: Official public notices may be erected on affected
property.
   D.   Nameplate: One nonilluminated nameplate not exceeding two (2) square
feet in area, and not containing lettering other than the name of the owner or
occupants or name or address of the premises.
   E.   Placement Of Signs: All signs shall be erected on the lot and no
portion of the sign shall encroach on a public right of way or other public
property. (1987 Code § 12-267)
 
Notes
1 1. See also title 9, chapter 9 of this code.
11-5-9: STRUCTURE SIZE:
No structure or building, intended to be a residence for human habitation,
comprising less than one thousand two hundred (1200) square feet, shall be
constructed, placed upon or moved upon any residential lot(s). (Ord. 2022-03,
8-26-2021)
CHAPTER 6
COMMERCIAL DISTRICTS
ARTICLE A. C-1 NEIGHBORHOOD SHOPPING DISTRICT
SECTION:
11-6A-1: General Description
11-6A-2: Uses Permitted
11-6A-3: Minimum Lot Size
11-6A-4: Area Regulations
11-6A-5: Height Regulations
11-6A-6: Off Street Parking
11-6A-7: Signs And Billboards
11-6A-1: GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
This commercial district is for the conduct of retail trade and personal
service enterprises to meet the regular needs and for the convenience of the
people of adjacent residential areas. Because these shops and stores may be an
integral part of the neighborhood closely associated with residential,
religious, recreational and educational uses, more restrictive requirements for
light, air, open space and off street parking are made than are provided in
other commercial districts. (1987 Code § 12-270)
11-6A-2: USES PERMITTED:
Property and buildings in a C-1 Neighborhood Shopping District shall be used
only for the following purposes:
   A.   Retail Stores: Retail stores and those which supply the regular and
customary needs of the residents of the neighborhood and which are primarily
for their convenience, as follows:
      Art school, gallery or museum.
      Artists’ materials, supply studio.
      Automobile parking lot.
      Baby shop.
      Bakery goods store.
      Barbershop.
      Beauty shop.
      Book or stationery store.
      Café.
      Camera shop.
      Candy store.
      Car wash facility.
      Cleaning, pressing, laundry collection agency.
      Curio or gift shop.
      Dairy products or ice cream store.
      Delicatessen.
      Dress shop.
      Drugstore or fountain.
      Farmers’ markets as provided in title 3, chapter 7 of this Code.
      Grocery store/convenience store not including the retail sale of
gasoline, diesel or other motor fuels.
      Jewelry or notions store.
      Medical facility.
      Messenger or telegraph service.
      Musical instrument sales.
      Newspaper or magazine sales.
      Office business.
      Optometrists sales and service. Pharmacy.
      Photographer studio.
      Radio and television sales and service.
      Self-service laundry or dry cleaning.
      Sewing machine sales, instruction.
      Shoe repair shop.
      Sporting goods sales.
      Tailor shop. Toy store.
   B.   Nameplate And Sign: Nameplate and sign relating only to the use of the
store and premises or to products sold on the premises; not to exceed twenty
(20) square feet, no flashing lights.
   C.   Accessory Buildings And Uses: Accessory buildings and uses customarily
incidental to the above uses.
   D.   Restrictions: A building used for any of the above enumerated uses may
not have more than forty percent (40%) of its floor area devoted to purposes
incidental to the primary use. No material or goods offered for sale or stored
in connection with the uses enumerated in subsections A through E of this
section shall be displayed or stored outside a building. (1987 Code § 12-271;
amd. Ord. 2004-10, 4-22-2004; Ord. 2005-05, 6-9-2005; Ord. 2014-13, 10-23-2014;
Ord. 2017-10, 10-26-2017; Ord. 2021-07, 3-25-2021; Ord. 2023-04, 2-23-2023)
11-6A-3: MINIMUM LOT SIZE:
None. (1987 Code § 12-272)
11-6A-4: AREA REGULATIONS:
The area requirements for dwellings shall be the same as the requirement of the
R General Residential District. The following requirements shall apply to all
other uses permitted in this district:
   A.   Front Yard: All buildings shall set back from the street right-of-way
line to provide a front yard having not less than twenty five feet (25') in
depth.
   B.   Side Yard: When siding on a residential district, the side yard setback
shall be one foot (1') for each one foot (1') of height of the commercial
primary structure. However, the side yard setback shall not be less than twenty
feet (20'), and a solid wall or fence shall be constructed in accordance with
section
11-9-9 of this title. There shall be a side yard setback from an intersecting
street of not less than twenty feet (20'). The side yard requirements of this
section shall not apply when abutting a C-2 General Commercial District or a C-
3 Intensive Commercial District.
   C.   Rear Yard: There shall be provided an alley, service court, rear yard,
or combination thereof, of not less than thirty feet (30'). (1987 Code § 12-
273)
11-6A-5: HEIGHT REGULATIONS:
No building shall exceed two and one-half (21/2) stories or thirty five feet
(35') in height based on the mean lot elevation. (1987 Code § 12-274)
11-6A-6: OFF STREET PARKING:
Buildings shall be provided with a yard area adequate to meet the off street
parking requirements set forth in chapter 9 of this title. (1987 Code § 12-275)
11-6A-7: SIGNS AND BILLBOARDS 1 :
Signs, billboards, posters, bulletin boards, or other similar displays in the
C-1 District shall conform to the following requirements: (1987 Code § 12-276)
   A.   Business Sign: One business sign not exceeding eighty (80) square feet
of surface area may be erected on each street frontage of the parcel. Ground
signs shall not exceed the height of the building in which the principal use is
located or twenty feet (20'), whichever is lower. No business sign shall be
located within fifty feet (50') of a residential district if visible from such
district. Illumination, if any, shall be by constant light. (Ord. 2015-02, 2-
23-2015)
   B.   Real Estate: A real estate sign advertising the sale, rental or lease
of the premises or an approved development area may be erected on each street
frontage of the parcel, development, or other agricultural, commercial or
industrial zoned tract having the same ownership as that of the property,
premises or tract being advertised. The sign shall not exceed one hundred fifty
(150) square feet in individual surface area nor fifteen feet (15') in height;
and illumination, if any, shall be by constant light.
   C.   Placement Of Signs: All signs in the C-1 District shall be erected upon
private property and shall not encroach upon any public street or walk, except
as provided by the applicable codes of the City and then they shall not
overhang at a height of less than nine feet (9') and shall not have a maximum
projection greater than seventy two inches (72") from the front building line.
(1987 Code § 12-276)
 
Notes
1 1. See also title 9, chapter 9 of this Code.
ARTICLE B. C-2 GENERAL COMMERCIAL DISTRICT
SECTION:
11-6B-1: General Description
11-6B-2: Uses Permitted
11-6B-3: Minimum Lot Size
11-6B-4: Open Display Uses Permitted
11-6B-5: Area Regulations
11-6B-6: Height Regulations
11-6B-7: Signs And Billboards
11-6B-1: GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
This commercial district is intended for the conduct of personal and business
services and the general retail business of the community. Persons living in
the community and in the surrounding trade territory require direct and
frequent access. Traffic generated by the uses will be primarily passenger
vehicles and those trucks and commercial vehicles required for stocking and
delivery of retail goods. (1987 Code § 12-280)
11-6B-2: USES PERMITTED:
Property and buildings in a C-2 general commercial district shall be used only
for the following purposes:
   A.   Uses In C-1 District: Any use permitted in a C-1 neighborhood
commercial district.
   B.   Uses Enclosed Within Building: When completely enclosed within a
building or buildings, the following uses are permitted:
Automobile and machinery repairing if conducted in conjunction with a retail
agency, but not including automobile or machinery wrecking establishments or
junkyards.
New automobile sales and service.
New machinery sales and service.
Public garages, provided no gasoline is stored aboveground.
Used automobile and machinery sales and service.
   C.   Uses Enumerated: The following uses are permitted:
Advertising signs or structures.
Ambulance service, office or garage.
Antique shop.
Appliance store.
Automobile retail gasoline service station.
      Bait sales.
Bakery.
Bank.
Catering establishment.
Child daycare facility.
Cleaning plant.
Clothing or apparel store.
Commercial school or hall.
Department store.
Drive-in restaurant.
Dry goods store.
Electric supply.
Electric transmission station.
Feed and seed store.
Florist shop, greenhouse, nursery.
Frozen food locker.
Funeral parlor or mortuary.
Furniture repair and upholstery.
Furniture store.
Golf course, miniature or practice range.
Grocery store/convenience store including the retail sale of gasoline, diesel
or other motor fuels.
Hardware store.
Heating, ventilating or plumbing supplies, sales and service.
Hospital for small animals.
Ice storage locker plant or storage house for food.
Interior decorating store.
Key shop.
Laboratories, testing and experimental.
Laundry.
Leather goods shop.
Lumberyard.
Meat market.
Museum.
Music or television shop.
Novelty shop.
Nursery or garden supply store.
Outdoor advertising signs.
Pawnshop.
Pet shop.
Printing plant.
Recreation centers.
Research laboratories.
Restaurant.
Sign painting shop.
Stock and bond broker.
Storage warehouse.
Theater.
Used automobile sales.
Variety store.
Wholesale distributing center.
Winery. (1987 Code § 12-281; amd. Ord. 1995-03, 12-14-1995; Ord. 2003-01, 1-9-
2003; Ord. 2006-01, 1-12-2006; Ord. 2017-10, 10-26-2017)
   D.   Accessory Buildings And Uses: Buildings, structures and uses accessory
and customarily incidental to any of the above uses; provided, that there shall
be no manufacturing, processing or compounding of products other than such as
are customarily incidental and essential to retail establishments.
   E.   Other Uses: Any other store or shop for retail trade or for rendering
personal, professional or business service which does not produce more noise,
odor, dust, vibration, blast or traffic than those enumerated above. (1987 Code
§ 12-281)
   F.   Sale, Auction: Sale or auction facility. (Ord. 2000-02, 3-10-2000)
   G.   Wrecker Services And Vehicle Impound Yards: Wrecker services and
vehicle impound yards provided they are enclosed by a solid fence of not less
than eight feet (8') in height, or all impounded vehicles are stored inside a
building. Wrecker services and impound yards do not include any form of vehicle
salvage, parting or wrecking operations. Wrecker service and impound yards
shall not be located on lots of less than two (2) acres in size. The size of
any impound yard shall not exceed two (2) acres regardless of the size of the
lot and the fence enclosing the impound yard shall be set back not less than
fifteen feet (15') from any property line, abutting road or street. In the
event existing rules or regulations require a greater setback, such greater
setback shall control. The principal entrance gate shall be set back not less
than one hundred feet (100') from the street, road or highway it abuts. (Ord.
2017-05, 5-25-2017)
11-6B-3: MINIMUM LOT SIZE:
None. (1987 Code § 12-282)
11-6B-4: OPEN DISPLAY USES PERMITTED:
   A.   Uses Enumerated: The following uses shall be permitted in the C-
2 General Commercial District; provided, that they comply with the additional
provisions of this subsection:
Boat sales and service.
Farm implement and machinery, new and used, sales.
Metal and wood fencing, ornamental grillwork and decorative wrought ironwork
and play equipment sales.
Mobile home and travel trailer sales.
Monument sales.
New and used automobile sales.
Prefabricated house sales.
Trailers for hauling, rental and sales.
   B.   Requirements: The uses enumerated in subsection A of this section shall
comply with the following provisions:
      1.   Landscaping Of Yards: All yards, unoccupied with buildings or
merchandise or not used as trafficways, shall be landscaped with grass and
shrubs and maintained in good condition the year round.
      2.   Lots And Driveways Paved: All of the lots used for the parking of
vehicles, for the storage and display of merchandise, and all driveways used
for vehicle ingress and egress shall be paved with a sealed surface pavement
and maintained in such a manner that no dust will be produced by continued use.
      3.   Servicing Vehicles; Enclosed Building: All servicing of vehicles
carried on as an incidental part of the sales operation shall be conducted
within a completely enclosed building.
      4.   Driveway Width: Driveways used for ingress and egress shall not
exceed twenty five feet (25') in width, exclusive of curb returns.
      5.   Outdoor Lighting: Outdoor lighting, when provided, shall have an
arrangement of reflectors and an intensity of lighting which will not interfere
with adjacent land uses or the use of adjacent streets, and shall not be of a
flashing or intermittent type. (1987 Code § 12-283)
11-6B-5: AREA REGULATIONS:
The area regulations for dwellings shall be the same as the requirements of the
R General Residential District. The following requirements shall apply to all
other uses permitted in this district:
   A.   Yards:
      1.   Front And Side Yard: There are no specific front or side yard
requirements for uses other than dwellings. When C-2 General Commercial
District abuts an R district, the front and side yard requirements shall be the
same as C-1 Neighborhood Commercial.
      2.   Rear Yard: There shall be provided an alley, service court, rear
yard, or combination thereof, of not less than thirty feet (30') in width.
   B.   Parking: Buildings shall be provided with a yard area adequate to meet
the off street parking requirements set forth in chapter 9 of this title. (1987
Code § 12-284)
11-6B-6: HEIGHT REGULATIONS:
No building or structure shall exceed ninety feet (90') in height. (1987 Code §
12-285)
11-6B-7: SIGNS AND BILLBOARDS 1 :
Signs, billboards, posters, bulletin boards, or other similar displays in the
C-2 District shall conform to the following requirements: (1987 Code § 12-286)
   A.   Business Sign: One business sign not exceeding eighty (80) square feet
of surface area may be erected on each street frontage of the parcel. Ground
signs shall not exceed the height of the building in which the principal use is
located or twenty feet (20'), whichever is lower. No business sign shall be
located within fifty feet (50') of a residential district if visible from such
district. Illumination, if any, shall be by constant light. (Ord. 2015-02, 2-
23-2015)
   B.   Real Estate Sign: A real estate sign advertising the sale, rental or
lease of the premises or an approved development area may be erected on each
street frontage of the parcel, development, or other agricultural, commercial
or industrial zoned tract having the same ownership as that of the property,
premises or tract being advertised. The sign shall not exceed one hundred fifty
(150) square feet in individual surface area nor fifteen feet (15') in height;
and illumination, if any, shall be by constant light.
   C.   Placement Of Signs: All signs in the C-2 District shall be erected upon
private property and shall not encroach upon any public street or walk, except
as provided by the applicable codes of the City and then they shall not
overhang at a height of less than nine feet (9') and shall not have a maximum
projection greater than seventy two inches (72"). (1987 Code § 12-286)

ARTICLE C. C-3 INTENSIVE COMMERCIAL DISTRICT
SECTION:
11-6C-1: General Description
11-6C-2: Uses Permitted
11-6C-3: Minimum Lot Size
11-6C-4: Area Regulations
11-6C-5: Height Regulations
11-6C-6: Signs And Billboards
11-6C-1: GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
This commercial district is intended for the conduct of personal and business
services and the general retail business of the community. Persons living in
the community and in the surrounding trade territory require direct and
frequent access. Traffic generated by the uses will be primarily passenger
vehicles and those trucks and commercial vehicles required for stocking and
delivery of retail goods. These uses create more traffic noise or congestion
thus require greater consideration as to location than do other commercial
uses. (1987 Code § 12-290)
11-6C-2: USES PERMITTED:
Property and buildings in a C-3 Intensive Commercial District shall be used
only for the following purposes:
   A.   Uses In C-2 District: Any use permitted in a C-2 General Commercial
District, except R General Residential uses.
   B.   Amusements; Enterprises: Amusements and other enterprises as follows:
Bus terminal.
Dance hall.
Drive-in theater.
Kennel.
Liquor store.
Motel.
Nightclub.
Recreational vehicle parks and/or campgrounds.
Roller skating rink.
Tavern.
Travel trailer park. (1987 Code § 12-291; amd. Ord. 1995-03, 12-14-1995; Ord.
2017-06, 7-27-2017)
   C.   Accessory Buildings And Uses: Buildings, structures and uses accessory
and customarily incidental to any of the above uses; provided, that there shall
be no manufacturing, producing or compounding of products other than such as
are customarily incidental and essential to retail establishments.
   D.   Other Stores, Shops: Any other store or shop for retail trade or for
rendering personal, professional or business service which does not produce
more noise, odor, dust, vibration, blast or traffic than those enumerated
above. (1987 Code § 12-291)
   E.   Correctional Facility: Correctional facility. (Ord. 1997-05, 5-1-1997)
11-6C-3: MINIMUM LOT SIZE:
None. (1987 Code § 12-292)
11-6C-4: AREA REGULATIONS:
The following requirements shall apply to all other uses permitted in this
district:
   A.   Yards:
      1.   Front And Side Yards: There are no specific front and side yard
requirements for uses. When C-3 Intensive Commercial abuts an R District, the
front and side yard requirements shall be the same as C-1 Neighborhood
Commercial District.
      2.   Rear Yard: There shall be provided an alley, service court, rear
yard, or combination thereof, of not less than thirty feet (30') in width.
   B.   Parking: Buildings shall be provided with a yard area adequate to meet
the off street parking requirements set forth in chapter 9 of this title. (1987
Code § 12-293)
11-6C-5: HEIGHT REGULATIONS:
No building or structure shall exceed ninety feet (90') in height. (1987 Code §
12-294)
11-6C-6: SIGNS AND BILLBOARDS 1 :
Signs, billboards, posters, bulletin boards, or other similar displays in the
C-3 District shall conform to the following requirements: (1987 Code § 12-295)
   A.   Business Sign: One business sign not exceeding eighty (80) square feet
of surface area may be erected on each street frontage of the parcel. Ground
signs shall not exceed the height of the building in which the principal use is
located or twenty feet (20'), whichever is lower. No business sign shall be
located within fifty feet (50') of a residential district if visible from such
district. Illumination, if any, shall be by constant light. (Ord. 2015-02, 2-
23-2015)
   B.   Real Estate Sign: A real estate sign advertising the sale, rental or
lease of the premises or an approved development area may be erected on each
street frontage of the parcel, development, or other agricultural, commercial
or industrial zoned tract having the same ownership as that of the property,
premises or tract being advertised. The sign shall not exceed one hundred fifty
(150) square feet in individual surface area nor fifteen feet (15') in height;
and illumination, if any, shall be by constant light.
   C.   Placement Of Signs: All signs in the C-3 District shall be erected upon
private property and shall not encroach upon any public street or walk, except
as provided by the applicable codes of the City and then they shall not
overhang at a height of less than nine feet (9') and shall not have a maximum
projection greater than seventy two inches (72") from the front building line.
(1987 Code § 12-295)
 
Notes
1 1. See also title 9, chapter 9 of this Code.
CHAPTER 7
I GENERAL INDUSTRIAL DISTRICT
SECTION:
11-7-1: General Description
11-7-2: Uses Permitted
11-7-3: Minimum Lot Size
11-7-4: Maximum Coverage
11-7-5: Yard Requirements
11-7-6: Height Limit
11-7-7: Off Street Parking And Loading
11-7-8: Signs And Billboards
11-7-1: GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
The purpose of the I general industrial district is to provide a location for
industries and to preserve such land for industry that is most beneficial to
industries and to prohibit nonindustrial uses. Because of the traffic generated
and other objectionable influences which may be created in this district, it is
necessary to provide a buffer or setback area between this district and any
other zoning district. (1987 Code § 12-300)
11-7-2: USES PERMITTED:
   A.   Permitted Uses: Property and buildings in an I district shall be used
only for the uses enumerated below. Any of the following uses shall be
permitted:
Automobile wrecking and junkyards, provided they are enclosed by a solid fence
of not less than eight feet (8') in height.
Bottling works, cannery, or preserving factories.
Building materials sales.
Commercial radio and television transmitting antenna towers and other
electronic equipment requiring outdoor towers, including antenna towers for the
dispatching of private messages.
Compounding, processing and blending of chemical products, but not including
any materials which decompose by detonation.
Fuel sales and storage.
General and administrative office.
Machine shops and metal products manufacture and tool and die shops, provided
they do not include any of the following equipment:
      1.   Automatic screw machines;
      2.   Drop forges; or
      3.   Riveting machines.
Mail order houses.
Manufacturing and assembling electrical and electronic products and equipment.
Manufacturing and assembling (for any combination of such processes) products
from cork, felt, fur, glass, leather, plastic, or wood, and other textiles, but
not including, as a principal operation, the processing of any raw materials.
Milk bottling and distribution.
Milling companies and grain elevators.
Motor freight terminals.
Outdoor shooting ranges for weapons provided such establishments are located so
that they do not pose a danger to residences, schools, churches or other
occupied structures.
Printing and binding plants.
Research laboratories.
Sheet metal shops.
Sign painting.
Utility service installation.
Warehouses and storage facilities.
Water filtration plants, pumping stations, reservoirs, and lift stations.
Welding shops. (1987 Code § 12-301; amd. Ord. 2012-03, 4-26-2012; Ord. 2017-05,
5-25-2017)
   B.   Other Processes Or Establishments: Any other manufacturing process or
establishment similar to the above.
   C.   Public Buildings, Uses: Any public building or use.
   D.   Retail Stores In C-1 District: All uses listed in subsection 11-6A-2C,
inclusive, of this title. (1987 Code § 12-301)
11-7-3: MINIMUM LOT SIZE:
There are no requirements for minimum lot area in the I District. (1987 Code §
12-302)
11-7-4: MAXIMUM COVERAGE:
Buildings shall not cover more than forty percent (40%) of the site on which
the use is located. (1987 Code § 12-303)
11-7-5: YARD REQUIREMENTS:
No structure shall be erected, commenced, or maintained which has a front yard
setback of less than fifty feet (50'). A side yard or rear yard of fifty feet
(50') or two feet (2') of setback for each one foot (1') of height, whichever
is greater, shall be provided when adjacent to a residential district, and
provided that a solid wall or fence in accordance with section
11-9-9 of this title shall be constructed on the side or rear property line
where the property abuts an R District, and a solid wall or fence in accordance
with section
11-9-9 of this title shall be constructed on all sides of a junk or salvage
yard. (1987 Code § 12-304)
11-7-6: HEIGHT LIMIT:
There are no requirements for minimum height in the I District. (1987 Code §
12-305)
11-7-7: OFF STREET PARKING AND LOADING:
Off street parking shall be as required in chapter 9 of this title. (1987 Code
§ 12-306)
11-7-8: SIGNS AND BILLBOARDS 1 :
Signs, billboards, posters, bulletin boards or other similar displays in the I
District shall conform to the following requirements:
   A.   Business Signs: Business signs not exceeding in the aggregate one
square foot of display surface area per one linear foot of street frontage may
be erected on each street frontage of the parcel. Ground signs and billboards
shall not exceed thirty feet (30') in height. No sign or billboard shall be
located within fifty feet (50') of a residential district if visible from such
district. Illumination, if any, shall be by constant light.
   B.   Real Estate Sign: A real estate sign advertising the sale, rental or
lease of the premises or an approved development area may be erected on each
street frontage of the parcel, development, or other agricultural, commercial
or industrial zoned tract having the same ownership as that of the property,
premises or tract being advertised. The sign shall not exceed one hundred fifty
(150) square feet in individual surface area nor fifteen feet (15') in height;
and illumination, if any, shall be by constant light.
   C.   Placement Of Signs: All signs in the I District shall be erected upon
private property and shall not encroach upon any public street or walk, except
as provided by the applicable codes of the City and then they shall not
overhang at a height of less than nine feet (9') and shall not have a maximum
projection greater than seventy two inches (72"). (1987 Code § 12-307)
 
Notes
1 1. See also title 9, chapter 9 of this Code.
CHAPTER 8
GENERAL PROVISIONS APPLYING TO ALL DISTRICTS
SECTION:
11-8-1: Compliance With District Regulations; Exception
11-8-2: More Restrictive District Regulations Prevail
11-8-3: Residential Uses Restricted To Residential Lots
11-8-4: Division Of Lots
11-8-5: Use Of Yards
11-8-6: Street Access
11-8-7: Trailers And Commercial Vehicles
11-8-8: Sewer Service
11-8-9: Group Housing Projects
11-8-10: Special Use Permits; Review; Communication Services
11-8-1: COMPLIANCE WITH DISTRICT REGULATIONS; EXCEPTION:
No land, building, structure, or improvement shall be used and no building,
structure, or improvement shall be made, erected, constructed, moved, altered,
enlarged, or rebuilt which is designed, arranged, or intended to be used or
maintained for any purpose or in any manner except in accordance with the use,
height, area, coverage, yard, space, and other requirements established in the
district in which such land, building, structure, or improvement is located,
and such use is not authorized, except as provided by chapter 10 of this title
regarding nonconformities. (1987 Code § 12-220)
11-8-2: MORE RESTRICTIVE DISTRICT REGULATIONS PREVAIL:
Whenever the specific district regulations pertaining to one district permit
the uses of a more restricted district, such uses shall be subject to the
conditions set forth in the regulations of the more restricted district, unless
otherwise specified. (1987 Code § 12-221)
11-8-3: RESIDENTIAL USES RESTRICTED TO RESIDENTIAL LOTS:
It is intended that this title be interpreted as not permitting a dwelling unit
to be located on the same lot with or within a structure used or intended to be
used primarily for nonresidential purposes, except that one accessory
residential unit may be provided for a night watchman, motel manager, or
similar purpose where essential to the main use of the lot. (1987 Code § 12-
222)
11-8-4: DIVISION OF LOTS:
An improved lot shall not hereafter be divided into two (2) or more lots unless
all lots resulting from such division comply with all the applicable yard,
space, area, parking and loading regulations of the zoning district in which
located. (1987 Code § 12-223)
11-8-5: USE OF YARDS:
No building, structure, or improvement shall be permitted to encroach upon
required yard spaces set forth in the provisions of this title. Surfaced
parking facilities, signs, fences, and gasoline pumping service units may be
permitted to occupy required yard space unless otherwise prohibited in those
districts permitting such improvements; and provided, that no inoperative
vehicle may be stored in the front yard of a lot in a residential district.
(1987 Code § 12-224)
11-8-6: STREET ACCESS:
No principal building shall hereafter be constructed on a lot which does not
abut a public dedicated street. (1987 Code § 12-225)
11-8-7: TRAILERS AND COMMERCIAL VEHICLES:
   A.   Parking On Lot: Commercial vehicles and trailers of all types,
including travel, camping and hauling, and mobile homes shall not be parked or
stored on any lot occupied by a dwelling or on any lot in any residential
district, except in accordance with the following provisions:
      1.   No more than one commercial vehicle, which does not exceed one and
one-half (11/2) tons' rated capacity, per family living on the premises shall
be permitted; and in no case shall a commercial vehicle used for hauling
explosives, gasoline, or liquefied petroleum products be permitted.
      2.   No more than one camping or travel trailer or hauling trailer per
family living on the premises shall be permitted, and the trailer shall not
exceed twenty four feet (24') in length or eight feet (8') in width. The
trailer shall not be parked for more than forty eight (48) hours unless it is
located behind the front yard building line. A camping or travel trailer shall
not be occupied either temporarily or permanently while it is parked or stored
in any area within the incorporated limits, except in a mobile home park
authorized under the ordinances of the city, except as provided for in
subsection B of this section.
      3.   A mobile home shall be parked or stored only in a mobile home park
which is in conformity with ordinances of the city.
   B.   Display Of Vehicles: Commercial vehicles and trailers of all types may
be displayed in such commercial districts allowing sales of the vehicles or in
such industrial districts allowing their manufacture. The vehicles may not be
used for dwelling purposes, either temporarily or permanently, except in a
mobile home park authorized under the ordinances of the city. (1987 Code § 12-
226)
11-8-8: SEWER SERVICE:
No structure or use in any district shall be erected or commenced which does
not have a connection to the public sewer system, unless and until the county
public health officer certifies that a septic tank or any substitute disposal
system can be installed and operated effectively. As a basis for making his
decision, the public health officer may require such percolation tests as he
deems to be necessary. Such tests are to be made at the expense of the property
owner. (1987 Code § 12-237)
11-8-9: GROUP HOUSING PROJECTS:
In the case of a housing project consisting of a group of two (2) or more
buildings to be constructed on a plot of ground of at least two (2) acres, the
height, area and setback requirements of this title may be modified by the city
council upon the recommendation of the planning commission following the
submission of an application for such development by the applicant in such
cases where the application will provide a development that will be in harmony
with the character of the neighborhood, will ensure a density of land use no
higher and a standard of open space at least as high as required by this title
in the district in which the proposed project is to be located. In no case
shall a use or building height or density of population be permitted which is
less than the requirements of the district in which the housing project is to
be located. (1987 Code § 12-238)
11-8-10: SPECIAL USE PERMITS; REVIEW; COMMUNICATION SERVICES:
The uses listed under the various districts herein as special permit uses are
so classified because they more intensely dominate the area in which they are
located than do other uses permitted in the district; however, the nature of
such uses make it desirable that they may be permitted to locate therein. The
following procedure is established to integrate property into special permit
uses with other land uses located in the district:
   A.   Review Process; Notice; Hearing: These uses shall be reviewed and
authorized or rejected under the following procedures:
      1.   An application shall be filed with the city planning commission for
review. The application shall show the location or intended use of the site,
the names of all the property owners and existing land uses within three
hundred feet (300') and any other material or information pertinent to the
request which the planning commission may require.
      2.   Notice shall be published and mailed to property owners at least
seven (7) days before the hearing.
      3.   The planning commission shall hold one or more public hearings
thereon.
      4.   The planning commission shall, within forty five (45) days of the
date of the application, transmit to the city council its report as to the
effect of such proposed building or use upon the character of the neighborhood,
traffic conditions, public utilities, and other matters pertaining to the
general welfare, and the recommendation of the planning commission concerning
the use thereon. Thereupon, the city council may authorize or deny the issuance
of a permit for the use of land or buildings as requested.
   B.   Filing Fee: Fees for the filing of a special use permit application
shall be set by motion or resolution of the city council.
   C.   Communication Services; Towers; Cellular Telephone, Radio And
Television: The following criteria are established for each use subject to
review before issuance of a special permit:
      1.   Districts: Eligible in A-1, A-2, C-2, C-3, industrial.
      2.   Height And Anchors:
         a.   Any tower anchored to the ground which is proposed to extend to a
height of over fifty feet (50').
         b.   Any tower attached to a building which is proposed to reach a
height over twenty feet (20') above the roofline of the building.
      3.   Standards For Ground Anchored Towers:
         a.   Towers and antennas shall be located on a site so as to provide a
minimum distance equal to one hundred ten percent (110%) of the height of the
tower from all property lines; provided, however, that the council may modify
this requirement where tower design will assure that a collapsing tower will
fall within a smaller area.
         b.   All tower supports and peripheral anchors shall be located
entirely within the boundaries of the property and shall not be less than five
feet (5') from the property line.
         c.   A wall or chainlink fence not less than eight feet (8') in height
from finished grade shall be provided around any high voltage equipment.
            (1)   Access shall be through a locked gate;
            (2)   Signs shall be located every twenty feet (20'), attached to
the fence or wall, and shall display in large bold letters the following:
   HIGH VOLTAGE - DANGER
         d.   Equipment, mobile or immobile, that is not necessary for direct
support of the use, shall not be stored or parked on the site unless repairs to
the facility are being made, or unless the zoning district permits such a use.
(Ord. 1996-04, 5-9-1996)
CHAPTER 9
OFF STREET PARKING AND LOADING
SECTION:
11-9-1: Purpose And Application
11-9-2: Required Open Space
11-9-3: Location Of Off Street Parking Lot
11-9-4: Joint Parking And Off Site Parking Facilities
11-9-5: Size Of Parking Space
11-9-6: Off Street Parking And Loading Schedule
11-9-7: Paved Surface Required
11-9-8: Location Within Or Adjacent To Residential District
11-9-9: Screening Wall Or Fence
11-9-1: PURPOSE AND APPLICATION:
It is the intent of this title that adequate parking and loading facilities be
provided on off the street areas for each use of land within the city.
Requirements are intended to be based on the demand created by each use. These
requirements shall apply to all uses in all districts. (1987 Code § 12-227)
11-9-2: REQUIRED OPEN SPACE:
Off street parking space may be a part of the required open space associated
with the permitted use, unless otherwise prohibited. The off street parking
requirements shall not be reduced or encroached upon in any manner. (1987 Code
§ 12-228)
11-9-3: LOCATION OF OFF STREET PARKING LOT:
The off street parking lot shall be located within two hundred feet (200'),
exclusive of street and alley widths, of the principal use and shall have
direct access to a street or alley. (1987 Code § 12-229)
11-9-4: JOINT PARKING AND OFF SITE PARKING FACILITIES:
Whenever two (2) or more uses are located together in a common building,
shopping center or other integrated building complex, the parking requirements
may be complied with by providing a permanent common parking facility
cooperatively established and operated, which contains the requisite number of
spaces for each use. Owners jointly provide for their individual parking needs
through a joint facility or facilities; provided, that the total number of
spaces so provided shall not be less than the sum of the individual
requirements, and that each business or other use is within two hundred feet
(200') of the parking facility. (1987 Code § 12-230)
11-9-5: SIZE OF PARKING SPACE:
The size of a parking space for one vehicle shall consist of a rectangular area
having dimensions of not less than ten feet by twenty feet (10' x 20') plus
adequate area for ingress and egress. (1987 Code § 12-231)
11-9-6: OFF STREET PARKING AND LOADING SCHEDULE:
Off street parking and loading facilities shall be provided in all districts in
accordance with the following schedule:
